Class RmiServer

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.RMI.Server.RmiServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ObserverModel, VirtualServer, Serializable, Remote
public class RmiServer extends UnicastRemoteObject implements ObserverModel, VirtualServer
The RmiServer class is responsible for managing the server-side implementation of the virtual server in a distributed RMI-based system. It extends UnicastRemoteObject and functions as both an ObserverModel and a VirtualServer, handling communication between client-side views and the server-side game logic. The class maintains the connection state of clients, handles updates to the game state, and implements various functionalities required to manage a multiplayer game. It supports client connection and disconnection, game setup, in-game operations, and real-time state updates. Additionally, the server can monitor client heartbeats to manage client disconnections.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • RmiServer

      public RmiServer(GameController gameController, int port) throws RemoteException
      Initializes the RMI server and binds it to the registry on the specified port. The server manages client connections, communication, and disconnections, as well as provides game-related updates through remote method invocation.
      Parameters:
      gameController - the GameController instance that manages the game logic and state
      port - the port number on which the RMI server will listen for incoming connections
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a networking-related issue occurs during initialization

  • Method Details

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down the RMI server by performing the following actions: - Unregisters the server instance from the RMI registry. - Unexports the server object to make it unavailable for clients. - Logs the shutdown status to the console. - Handles any exceptions that might occur during the shutdown process, such as: - RemoteException: Issues related to networking or RMI infrastructure. - NotBoundException: Occurs if the server is not bound in the registry. - Terminates the application using System.exit(0).
      Specified by:
      shutdown in interface ObserverModel

    • updateShipboardList

      public void updateShipboardList(Map<String,Shipboard> shipboards)
      Updates the shipboard list for all connected clients by notifying them of the current shipboards associated with each player.
      Specified by:
      updateShipboardList in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      shipboards - a map containing player names as keys and their respective Shipboard objects as values

    • updateAllLeaderboard

      public void updateAllLeaderboard(Map<String,Integer> leaderCards)
      Updates all connected clients with the latest leaderboard data. The method iterates through all connected clients and calls their respective method to display the updated leaderboard. In case of remote exceptions, it handles the error by logging and removing the problematic client.
      Specified by:
      updateAllLeaderboard in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      leaderCards - a map containing player nicknames as keys and their associated leaderboard scores as values

    • updateGameLoaded

      public void updateGameLoaded(Game game)
      Handles the receipt of a heartbeat signal from a client. This method is invoked by the client to indicate that it is still active. The nickname of the client is logged, and the heartbeatManager is updated to record the heartbeat for the client.
      Specified by:
      updateGameLoaded in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      game - the unique identifier of the client sending the heartbeat

      public void quit(String playerName)
      Handles the process of a player quitting the game. Removes the player from the game and unregisters their heartbeat tracking.

      quit in interface VirtualServer

    • getVirtualServerType

      public String getVirtualServerType() throws RemoteException
      Returns the type of the virtual server.
      Specified by:
      getVirtualServerType in interface VirtualServer
      Returns:
      a string indicating the type of the virtual server, which is "rmi" in this implementation
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a communication-related error occurs

    • connect

      public void connect(VirtualView client, String nickname) throws RemoteException
      Handles the connection of a client to the server lobby. This method checks if the nickname is valid, if the lobby is full, or if the game is already in progress. Based on these checks, it updates the client with the connection outcome and manages the client's involvement in the current game or lobby.
      Specified by:
      connect in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      client - a VirtualView instance representing the client attempting to connect
      nickname - a String representing the desired nickname of the connecting client
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects the client from the RMI server. This method handles the disconnection process, ensuring that any resources associated with the client are released, and updates the server state to reflect the client's departure. Implementations should ensure that the client is properly removed from any active sessions, and other clients are notified of the disconnection if necessary.
      Specified by:
      disconnect in interface VirtualServer

    • setNumPlayers

      public void setNumPlayers(int numPlayers) throws IOException
      Sets the number of players for the game. The value must be between the allowed range (inclusive), typically 2 to 4 players. Throws an exception if the value is invalid.
      Specified by:
      setNumPlayers in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - the number of players to set for the game
      Throws:
      IOException - if the provided number of players is not within the valid range

    • updatePlayerJoined

      public void updatePlayerJoined(String nickname)
      Updates all connected clients about a new player joining the game. This method sends a notification to all clients except the one associated with the joining player. If an exception occurs during the update, it handles the client error appropriately.
      Specified by:
      updatePlayerJoined in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who has joined the game

    • updateLobby

      public void updateLobby()
      Updates the state of the game lobby by retrieving the list of players, their readiness status, and the current game type from the game controller. This information is then sent to all connected clients via their respective VirtualView objects. The method iterates through the list of connected clients and invokes the showLobbyUpdate method on each client's VirtualView to synchronize the lobby state. If an exception occurs during this operation, it is logged and handled appropriately. The lobby state consists of: - The list of players currently in the lobby. - The readiness status of each player. - The type of game currently selected. If a RemoteException is encountered while attempting to update a client, the specific client causing the error is handled using the internal handleClientError method to address the issue.
      Specified by:
      updateLobby in interface ObserverModel

    • updateGameStarted

      public void updateGameStarted()
      Notifies all connected clients that the game has started by invoking the showGameStarted() method on each client. If a RemoteException occurs while notifying a client, the error is logged, and the associated client is handled appropriately using the handleClientError(VirtualView, RemoteException) method. This method ensures that every client in the connectedClients list receives an update about the game's start, maintaining synchronization across all connected clients. Exceptions: - RemoteException: Handles communication errors between the server and the client, such as a disconnection during the update. This exception is logged and further handled using the handleClientError method. - Generic exceptions are caught and ignored with no additional handling, ensuring the method continues processing other clients in case of an unexpected error.
      Specified by:
      updateGameStarted in interface ObserverModel

    • updateBank

      public void updateBank(Bank bank)
      Updates the bank information for all connected clients. This method iterates through the list of connected clients, attempting to update each client with the new bank state using the showUpdateBank method. If an exception occurs during the update, the error is logged, and appropriate error handling is performed.
      Specified by:
      updateBank in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      bank - the updated Bank instance containing the latest state of resources to be communicated to the connected clients

    • updateTileInHand

      public void updateTileInHand(String player, ComponentTile ct)
      Updates the specified player's hand with the given component tile by notifying all connected clients. Each client receives the update through the `showUpdateTileInHand` method, with any errors during the update process being handled.
      Specified by:
      updateTileInHand in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player whose hand is being updated
      ct - the component tile to be added to the player's hand

      Specified by:
      updateDices in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:

    • updateCurrPlayer

      public void updateCurrPlayer(String currPlayer)

      Specified by:
      updateCurrPlayer in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      currPlayer - the nickname of the current player to be updated on all clients

This method iterates through the list of connected clients and invokes the showUpdateGamePhase method on each VirtualView to notify them of the updated game phase. Handles any RemoteException or generic exceptions during the update process.
      Specified by:
      updateGamePhase in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      gamePhase - the GamePhase object representing the current phase of the game to be communicated to clients

      Specified by:

    • updateGame

      public void updateGame(Game game)

      Specified by:
      updateGame in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      game - the updated Game instance containing the latest game state to be sent to clients

    • updateStopHourglass

      public void updateStopHourglass()
      Sends a stop hourglass update to all connected clients. This method iterates over the list of connected clients and invokes the showUpdateStopHourglass() method on each client to notify them of the update. If a client throws a RemoteException, it handles the error by logging the issue and invoking handleClientError() to manage the disconnection and appropriately update the server state. Any other exceptions encountered during the execution of this method are caught and ignored.
      Specified by:
      updateStopHourglass in interface ObserverModel

    • updateStartHourglass

      public void updateStartHourglass(int hourglassSpot)
      Updates all connected clients with the start hourglass state for the specified hourglass spot. The method iterates through the list of connected clients and invokes the showUpdateStartHourglass method on each client to notify them of the update. Handles remote exceptions by logging the error and calling the handleClientError method.
      Specified by:
      updateStartHourglass in interface ObserverModel
      Parameters:
      hourglassSpot - the identifier of the hourglass spot that has started

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String nickname)
      Removes a player from the game by their nickname. This method performs several actions: - Removes the player from the game controller. - Removes the player's associated data from the client map. - Unregisters the player from the heartbeat manager.
      Specified by:
      removePlayer in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique identifier of the player to be removed

    • setPlayerReady

      public void setPlayerReady(String nickname)
      Marks a player as ready in the game lobby. This method updates the player's status within the game logic and triggers a refresh of all active lobbies.
      Specified by:
      setPlayerReady in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to be marked as ready

    • startGameByHost

      public void startGameByHost(String nickname) throws RemoteException
      Starts the game when initiated by the host player in the lobby phase. The method validates whether the requester is the host, checks if all players are ready, and initiates the game if all conditions are met. If any condition fails, appropriate error messages are sent back to the client (host or player).
      Specified by:
      startGameByHost in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player attempting to start the game. This should match the host player's nickname for the game to start successfully.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a communication-related exception occurs during the remote method call.

    • setPlayerNotReady

      public void setPlayerNotReady(String nickname)
      Sets the specified player as not ready in the game's lobby. If the game is in the lobby state, the player's readiness status will be updated. Otherwise, the operation is not permitted outside the lobby state.
      Specified by:
      setPlayerNotReady in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique identifier of the player whose readiness status is to be set to not ready

    • setGameType

      public void setGameType(String gameType)
      Sets the game type for the server. Only supports "level2" and "tutorial" as valid game types. If a supported game type is specified, it updates the game type in the game controller, refreshes all associated lobbies, and marks the game as started. If the game type is invalid, an error message is logged.
      Specified by:
      setGameType in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      gameType - the type of game to be set. Supported values are "level2" and "tutorial".

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame() throws IOException
      Activates god mode for the specified player with the provided configuration. This method enables modified game mechanics, allowing the player to perform special actions or have particular advantages as per the game's rules.
      Specified by:
      loadGame in interface VirtualServer
      Throws:
      IOException

    • godMode

      public void godMode(String nickname, String conf)
      Specified by:
      godMode in interface VirtualServer

    • pickCoveredTile

      public void pickCoveredTile(String nickname)
      Allows a player, identified by their nickname, to pick a covered tile during the game. This action is managed by the GameController.
      Specified by:
      pickCoveredTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player performing the action

    • pickUncoveredTile

      public void pickUncoveredTile(String nickname, String pngName)
      Allows a player to pick an uncovered tile during the game. This action is handled by the gameController which ensures the game is in the appropriate state and manages the tile selection process.
      Specified by:
      pickUncoveredTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player picking the tile
      pngName - the name of the tile's image file (PNG format) to identify the selected tile

    • rotateClockwise

      public void rotateClockwise(String nickname, int rotationNum)
      Rotates a player's component tiles clockwise a specified number of times. This action is only permitted during the game phase.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique identifier of the player requesting the rotation
      rotationNum - the number of 90-degree clockwise rotations to apply

    • rotateCounterClockwise

      public void rotateCounterClockwise(String nickname, int rotationNum)
      Rotates the game component associated with a specified player counterclockwise a given number of times. Each rotation step is applied sequentially.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose game component is to be rotated
      rotationNum - the number of times the component should be rotated counterclockwise

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(String nickname, int i, int j, int numOfRotations) throws IOException
      Welds a component tile onto a specified position on the gameboard after performing the necessary rotations based on the provided parameter. Positive values for rotations indicate clockwise rotations, whereas negative values indicate counter-clockwise rotations. If no rotations are provided, the tile is directly welded onto the specified position.
      Specified by:
      weldComponentTile in interface VirtualServer
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who is performing the weld action
      i - the row index on the gameboard where the component tile should be welded
      j - the column index on the gameboard where the component tile should be welded
      numOfRotations - the number of rotations to apply to the tile before welding it; positive for clockwise, negative for counter-clockwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the execution of the operation

    • standbyComponentTile

      public void standbyComponentTile(String nickname)
      Puts the specified player's component tile into standby mode during the game phase. This action is only valid if the game is currently in the GAME state.

      Parameters:

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Terminates the ongoing game and invokes the associated process to conclude the game session. This method delegates the operation to the GameController to ensure appropriate game state handling and finalization logic. In cases where the game is not in the active game state, the process will not proceed, and an appropriate message will be logged. The exact operations and results are managed within the GameController.
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface VirtualServer
